QuantumInformation.applychannel â Method.
applychannel(Î¦, Ï)
  • Î¦: list of vectors.
  • Ï: input matrix.

Return application of channel Î¦onÏ`. Kraus representation of quantum channel $\Phi$ is a set $\{K_i\}_{i\in I}$ of bounded operators on $\mathcal{H}$ such that $\sum_{i\in I} K_i^\dagger K_i = \mathcal{1}$. Then $\Phi(\rho)=\sum_{i\in I} K_i \rho K_i^\dagger$.

Application of Stinespring representation of quantum channel into state Ï.

QuantumInformation.max_entangled â Method.
max_entangled(d)
  • d: length of the vector.

Return maximally entangled state $\frac{1}{\sqrt{d}}\sum_{i=0}^{\sqrt{d}-1}|ii\rangle$ of length $\sqrt{d}$.

QuantumInformation.max_mixed â Method.
max_mixed(d)

Return maximally mixed state $\frac{1}{d}\sum_{i=0}^{d-1}|i\rangle\langle i |$ of length $d$.

QuantumInformation.shannon_entropy â Method.
shannon_entropy(x)
  • x: real number.

Return binary Shannon entorpy given by $-x \log(x) - (1 - x) \log(1 - x)$.

QuantumInformation.werner_state â Method.
werner_state(d, Î±)
  • d: length of the vector.
  • Î±: real number from [0, 1].

Returns Werner state given by $\frac{\alpha}{d}\left(\sum_{i=0}^{\sqrt{d}-1}|ii\rangle\right) \left(\sum_{i=0}^{\sqrt{d}-1}\langle ii|\right)+ \frac{1-\alpha}{d}\sum_{i=0}^{d-1}|i\rangle\langle i|$.
